availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Spurling (Taylor County, Kentucky, farmer and jailer.)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, wagon maker, farmer, and jailer. Virginia native. Married to Jane Newton Spurling. Father of M. A. Spurling, Nancy J. Spurling, B. F. Spurling, Elizabeth Spurling, and Sarah L. Spurling. Wagon maker in Taylor County in 1850. Farmer in Taylor County in 1860. Jailer in Taylor County in 1862. Jailer in Taylor County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Division 1, p. 162B-163A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, p. 572.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 234A.
Find A Grave, "John Kipsey Spurling (1813-1897)," Memorial 59146009, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59146009/john-kipsey-spurling (accessed July 1, 2020).
